pageContext.claim: “The Democrats don’t want to approve [Trump's infrastructure proposal] because they don’t want to give us a victory. ”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is rewriting political stances again. The Democrats argue that the money allocated in Trump's bill is too little to make a real impact and that the plan is designed to help developers not cities and states pay for infrastructure improvements. Plus, they are resistant to any plan that includes budget cuts, likely to programs they support, and environmental rule rollbacks.
